Players with bans or chat restrictions active when the season ends are ineligible for this year’s rewards.
Players issued a ban of seven days or more from 8/22/2017 are ineligible for this year’s rewards.
Players banned for boosting during the 2017 season remain ineligible for rewards.
Players who experience fraud-related or erroneous bans will still be eligible.

If you got a 14 day ban it means your account is in really bad standing and it won't get any rewards until you get it back into good standings. That means you have to stop being reported in every game and start playing honorably. Once the reports against your account stop it will slowly start to climb back into good standings and you'll be eligible  for rewards, but as it stands now, no you won't get the rewards.

Sometimes you get bad team-mates, sometimes people will flame you for nothing & sometimes you'll get annoyed.

You have to not say anything and continue playing as normal, learn to ignore them. After just 1 game of not retaliating to flame or flaming a 0/12/0 jungler, you'll see the difference.

You won't get your rewards, justifiably so. But you can improve and get them next season :)

This is from someone who has lost rewards himself.
